text: John Verkuilen (September 3, 1867 - January 24, 1936) was an American farmer and politician. Born in the town of Pensaukee, Oconto County, Wisconsin, Verkuilen worked in the shipyard in Sheboygan, Wisconsin. In 1894, Verkuilen, his wife, and family moved to the town of Worden, Clark County, Wisconsin and started a farm. Verkuilen served on the Worden Town Board, the Pioneer School Board, and on the Clark County Board of Supervisors. In 1921, Verkuilen served in the Wisconsin State Assembly as a Republican. In 1927, Verkuilen and his wife moved to Thorp, Wisconsin. Verkuilen died in a hospital in Chippewa Falls, Wisconsin.'Wisconsin Blue Book 1921,' Biographical Sketch of John Verkuilen, pg. 263'John Verkuilen-obituary,' Thorp Courier (Wisconsin), February 6, 1936 ==Notes== Category:1867 births Category:1936 deaths Category:People from Clark County, Wisconsin Category:People from Oconto County, Wisconsin Category:Farmers from Wisconsin Category:School board members in Wisconsin Category:County supervisors in Wisconsin Category:Wisconsin city council members Category:Wisconsin Republicans Category:Members of the Wisconsin State Assembly Category:People from Thorp, Wisconsin
title: John Verkuilen
